task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 109°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full height of the building to estimate it, so I will first look up to find the roofline.
I seem to have turned away from the target building, which is to the East; I need to rotate back to face it at approximately 109 degrees.
I am facing the correct building again but still can't see the top, so I will tilt my view upwards to find the roofline.
My heading was reset to 0° again after looking up; I need to rotate back to face the target building at 109° East while keeping my upward pitch to see the roof.
I am facing the correct building, but I need to see the top to estimate its height, so I will tilt my view up again.
My heading has reset to 0° North again; I must rotate back to 109° East to face the target building while maintaining my upward pitch.
I have now seen the top and bottom of the building; it appears to be about 8 stories tall, and assuming a standard story height of 3.5 meters, I estimate the total height to be 28 meters.
